subject: Parenting
title: The Intensive Parenting Era
description: Learn The Intensive Parenting Era in one minute.

hook.text: Modern parents spend more time with their kids than parents in the 1960s â€” despite both parents working.

buildup.text: Intensive parenting treats child-rearing as a full-time optimization project.

discovery.text: Parents now spend more hours on enrichment activities, homework help, and supervised play than ever before.

twist.text: Children haven't become proportionally better off. Parental burnout and childhood anxiety have both risen.

climax.text: More time isn't the same as better time. Quality of presence matters more than quantity of hours.

punchline.text: More parenting isn't always better parenting. Sometimes less is exactly enough.

quiz.question: What has increased alongside the rise of intensive parenting?
options: Both parental burnout and childhood anxiety
